quotes.quote: Punishment is not for revenge, but to lessen crime and reform the criminal.
The liar's punishment is not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else.
The punishment which the wise suffer who refuse to take part in the government, is to live under the government of worse men.
It is not the punishment but the cause that makes the martyr.

Punishment is now unfashionable... because it creates moral distinctions among men, which, to the democratic mind, are odious. We prefer a meaningless collective guilt to a meaningful individual responsibility.
Punishment cannot heal spirits, can only break them.
The first and greatest punishment of the sinner is the conscience of sin.
Capital punishment is as fundamentally wrong as a cure for crime as charity is wrong as a cure for poverty.
All pain is a punishment, and every punishment is inflicted for love as much as for justice.
All punishment is mischief; all punishment in itself is evil.
There must be no worse punishment to a totalitarian nation than the withdrawal of capital.
Punishment for doing your job well is an unparalleled professional pressure.
Capital punishment is our society's recognition of the sanctity of human life.
Punishment may make us obey the orders we are given, but at best it will only teach an obedience to authority, not a self-control which enhances our self-respect.
Let the punishment be proportionate to the offense.
Punishment is justice for the unjust.
The punishment of criminals should serve a purpose. When a man is hanged he is useless.

Any punishment that does not correct, that can merely rouse rebellion in whoever has to endure it, is a piece of gratuitous infamy which makes those who impose it more guilty in the eyes of humanity, good sense and reason, nay a hundred times more guilty than the victim on whom the punishment is inflicted.
Capital punishment would be more effective as a preventive measure if it were administered prior to the crime.
All in all, punishment hardens and renders people more insensible; it concentrates; it increases the feeling of estrangement; it strengthens the power of resistance.
What punishments of God are not gifts?
An unjust punishment is never forgotten.
Punishment is a vital need of the human soul.
Punishments erode relationships and moral growth.
No punishment is so terrible as prosperous guilt.
Punishment closely follows guilt as its companion.
Punishment renders autonomy of conscience impossible.
Divine punishment is at once followed by Divine pity.
Punishment is God's. He alone is the infallible Judge.
The power of punishment is to silence, not to confute.
